revised_title: Observations on the Atmospheres of Venus and the Moon
tldr: The author, John Jerome Schroeter, conducted observations on the atmospheres of Venus and the Moon, focusing on their respective densities, perpendicular heights, and the twi-light caused by them. He discovered that Venus has an atmosphere similar to Earth, which is denser and more capable of weakening the sun's rays compared to the Moon's atmosphere. The author also observed a unique phenomenon where a streak of glowing light extended from the northern cusp of Venus into the dark hemisphere, which he had never seen before.
